alert.note: Alert for Hamilton (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 2:43PM CDT until August 09 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT/645 PM EDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Bledsoe, Hamilton, Meigs and Rhea. * WHEN...Until 545 PM CDT /645 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 243 PM CDT /343 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dayton, Decatur, Soddy-Daisy, Spring City, Graysville, Evensville, Old Washington, Big Spring, Birchwood, Sale Creek, Stinging Fork Falls State Park, Brayton, Piney Falls State Park, Peakland, Flat Top Mountain, Mowbray Mountain and Ten Mile. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
